abstract: A convolutional neural network for classifying time series data uses a dynamic context selection. In one example a method includes receiving a plurality of inputs of different sizes at a convolutional neural network, applying convolution and pooling to each of the inputs to provide a plurality of outputs of different sizes, changing the size of each of the outputs to a selected uniform size, reshaping each of the outputs to a vector, and fully connecting the vectors.
summary: <SOH> BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE DRAWINGS <EOH>Embodiments are illustrated by way of example, and not by way of limitation, in the figures of the accompanying drawings in which like reference numerals refer to similar elements. FIG. 1 is a modular block diagram of convolutional neural network models. FIG. 2 is a modular block diagram of convolutional neural network models with a context selection according to an embodiment. FIG. 3 is a diagram of a process for context selection according to an embodiment. FIG. 4 is a diagram of an alternative process for context selection according to an embodiment. FIG. 5 is a block diagram of a computing device incorporating regions proposal and object detection and classification according to an embodiment. detailed-description description="Detailed Description" end="lead"?
title: DYNAMIC CONTEXT-SELECTIVE CONVOLUTIONAL NEURAL NETWORK FOR TIME SERIES DATA CLASSIFICATION
